string-array.name: godown_quotes
string-array.item: To live a creative life, we must lose our fear of being wrong.\nAnonymous
The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.\nBruce Lee
There are two types of people who will tell you that you cannot make a difference in this world: those who are afraid to try and those who are afraid you will succeed.\nRay Goforth
If you don\'t design your own life plan, chances are you\'ll fall into someone else\'s plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.\nJim Rohn
Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.\nGeorge Bernard Shaw
Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.\nJim Ryun
You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.\nMargaret Thatcher
Life is what happens when you\'re busy making other plans.\nJohn Lennon;
Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.\nBabe Ruth
Get busy living or get busy dying.\nStephen King
Many of life\'s failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.\nThomas A. Edison
You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.\nMae West
The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinions.\nJames Russell Lowell
Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.\nFarrah Gray
“Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.”\nOprah Winfrey
“Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.”\nOliver Goldsmith
“Do not be embarrassed by your failures, learn from them and start again.”\nRichard Branson
“Success is simple. Do what’s right, the right way, at the right time.”\nArnold H. Glasgow
“Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.”\nThomas A. Edison
“The best revenge is massive success.”\nFrank Sinatra
“Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do. Don’t wish it were easier; wish you were better.”\nJim Rohn
“Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.”\nRoy T. Bennett
The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.\nOprah Winfrey
"Arise! Awake! and stop not until the goal is reached.\nSwami Vivekananda"
All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.\nWalt Disney
Good things come to people who wait, but better things come to those who go out and get them.\nAnonymous
If you do what you always did, you will get what you always got.\nAnonymous
Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.\nWinston Churchill
Opportunities don\'t happen, you create them.\nChris Grosser
Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.\nEleanor Roosevelt
If you don\'t value your time, neither will others. Stop giving away your time and talents- start charging for it.\nKim Garst
No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.\nEleanor Roosevelt
The ones who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones that do.\nAnonymous
What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise.\n Oscar Wilde
When you stop chasing the wrong things you give the right things a chance to catch you.\nLolly Daskal
Don\'t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.\nJohn D. Rockefeller
If you can\'t explain it simply, you don\'t understand it well enough.\nAlbert Einstein
Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.\nLolly Daskal
I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.\nThomas Jefferson
The starting point of all achievement is desire.\nNapolean Hill
We become what we think about most of the time, and that\'s the strangest secret.\nEarl Nightingale
The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.\nVidal Sassoon
The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.\nBruce Lee
You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.\nMae West
The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinions. \nJames Russell Lowell
Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.\nFarrah Gray
“Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.” – Oprah Winfrey
“Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.” \nOliver Goldsmith
“Do not be embarrassed by your failures, learn from them and start again.” \nRichard Branson
“Success is simple. Do what’s right, the right way, at the right time.” \nArnold H. Glasgow
“Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.” \nThomas A. Edison
“The best revenge is massive success.” \nFrank Sinatra
The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus. \nBruce Lee
Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time. \nGeorge Bernard Shaw
Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going. \nJim Ryun
You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it. \nMargaret Thatcher
Life is what happens when you\'re busy making other plans. \nJohn Lennon;
Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game. \nBabe Ruth
Get busy living or get busy dying. \nStephen King
Many of life\'s failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up. \nThomas A. Edison
“Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do. Don’t wish it were easier; wish you were better.” \nJim Rohn
“Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.” \nRoy T. Bennett
The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude. \nOprah Winfrey
"Allow yourself to be proud of yourself and all the progress you\'ve made Especially the progress that no one else has seen. \nUnknown"
"Arise! Awake! and stop not until the goal is reached. \nSwami Vivekananda"
All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them. \nWalt Disney
Good things come to people who wait, but better things come to those who go out and get them. \nAnonymous
If you do what you always did, you will get what you always got. \nAnonymous
Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm. \nWinston Churchill
Opportunities don\'t happen, you create them. \nChris Grosser
Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people. \nEleanor Roosevelt
If you don\'t value your time, neither will others. Stop giving away your time and talents- start charging for it. \nKim Garst
No one can make you feel inferior without your consent. \nEleanor Roosevelt
The ones who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones that do. \nAnonymous
What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise.\n Oscar Wilde
When you stop chasing the wrong things you give the right things a chance to catch you. \nLolly Daskal
Don\'t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great. \nJohn D. Rockefeller
If you can\'t explain it simply, you don\'t understand it well enough. \nAlbert Einstein
Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself. \nLolly Daskal
I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have. \nThomas Jefferson
The starting point of all achievement is desire. \nNapolean Hill
We become what we think about most of the time, and that\'s the strangest secret. \nEarl Nightingale
The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary. \nVidal Sassoon
"Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it. \nBruce Lee"
